Gale_Potential.synopsis: Wyll tells Gale he's got potential, and suggests he rename himself something more... heroic. Gale finds Wyll quite the tryhard.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002.synopsis: Banter between SH and WyllSH Selune path

Astarion_Forest.synopsis: Wyll and Astarion banter in FOR

Halsin_ThormMausoleum.synopsis: Banter between Wyll and Halsin in a mausoleum

Gale_Bomb.synopsis: Wyll points out that Gale has two ticking time-bombs inside him - but he's holding together pretty well.

Laezel_Illithid2.synopsis: Wyll asks Laezel in banter if every mind flayer must follow the hivemind.

Astarion_Vampire.synopsis: Wyll asks Astarion if maybe he can't just suck on rats or something and leave people alone. Astarion replies with a lore-ish quip.

ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark.synopsis: banter between SH and Wyll in a park.

Laezel_Gale_Illithid1.synopsis: Wyll asks Lae'zel about mind flayers. Do they have a leader? A god? Lae'zel comments about elder brains. Gale adds a thought if he is present.

Astarion_Drink.synopsis: Wyll remarks that he could use a good strong drink. Astarion concurs. Wyll says that isn't what he meant.

Gale_Tadpole.synopsis: Wyll points out that he used to kill big monsters, and now a few goblins are a challenge. What gives? Gale remarks it must be the tadpole.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001.synopsis: Banter between SH and WyllSH Shar path

Halsin_PhilgraveMansion.synopsis: Banter between Wyll and Halsin in a creepy mansion.

Gale_Astarion_Netherese.synopsis: Wyll recalls the hag said 'Netherese' and asks Gale what he knows. Astarion adds a thought if he is present.

Astarion_Hunting.synopsis: Wyll remarks on Astarion being a vampire. Jokes - kind of - about hunting him.

Shadowheart_Selune.synopsis: Wyll asks Shadowheart what her beef is with Selune. Selune drops a bit of Selune/Shar lore in response. Shadowheart is known to be a Shar worshipper.

Laezel_Altruism.synopsis: Wyll asks Lae'zel if she ever does anything out of the goodness of her heart. Lae'zel finds the entire concept alien.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: I saw you pressing a bunch of flowers the other day in a book.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Not like you to keep something forever.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: They'll crumble away in time... but no harm in appreciating their beauty until then.

Gale_Potential_2.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Potential_2.text: You're an impressive fighter, Gale. You should consider a new name.

Gale_Potential_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Potential_1.text: I take it you have some suggestions?

Gale_Potential_3.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Potential_3.text: 'The Wizard Wonder!' Or how about, 'The Master of the Weave'?

Gale_Potential_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Potential_0.text: Tempting. But I think we might already have the maximum number of theatrical titles.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonrisePrison_1.text: Not a devil in sight. How disappointing.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_4.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_4.text: I doubt a few iron bars are sufficient to hold one of Zariel's.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_7.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonrisePrison_7.text: True enough. But an illithid pod? That would probably do the trick.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_2.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_2.text: I wager you're right. Ah, Gale - what a pleasure to see a genius' mind at work.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_3.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_3.text: Of course Mizora was Zariel's captured asset. How did I not see it coming?

Gale_MoonrisePrison_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonrisePrison_0.text: It's in a devil's nature to conceal the truth - you can't fault yourself for that.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_9.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_9.text: I've been pacted for seven years on, Gale. I should be able to read between Mizora's lines by now, no matter how narrow the gap.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_8.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonrisePrison_8.text: How long have you been pacted to Mizora, Wyll?

Gale_MoonrisePrison_6.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_6.text: Seven years. Seven years of hunting the monsters of the Sword Coast - and seven years of Mizora's tight leash.

Gale_MoonrisePrison_5.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonrisePrison_5.text: And seven years of wondering if I'd ever rid myself of her - or if I even should.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: Even if you and our friend ended up having werewolf cubs, they'd be so adorable.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: Ahem. I've shown no signs of lycanthropy, thank you very much... but should that change, I'll take it you're volunteering to be child-minder.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly flustered. Hiding it with a comeback. Arc: SH has turned from Shar (and therefore knows her farther is apparently a werewolf). Also referring to her being in a romantic relationship with  the player

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: Hm. Buy me some protective gloves, and I'm all for it.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: Shadowheart - the way you paint around your eyes, they look permanently cloaked in shadow.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_4.text: It brings me closer to Lady Shar. One day, all of our eyes will feast on her endless darkness.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_4.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH loyal to Shar/known as a shar worshipper

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: No harm in a little mystery...
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.context: NodeContext: Coy. Arc: SH loyal to Shar/not known as a shar worshipper

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Besides, I think it suits my bone structure.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_1.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: And yet your bed-pillow bears barely a smudge. You are a woman of many talents.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: I really hope you're being careful with our friend, Minthara. I wouldn't want you to break each other.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: If I break them, it will be in the pursuit of pleasure, and they will die smiling.

Astarion_Forest_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Forest_1.text: As much love as I hold for Baldur's Gate, these frontiers delight me as much as any bustling street.

Astarion_Forest_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Forest_2.text: You can't be serious? This is a howling wasteland!

Astarion_Forest_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Forest_3.text: I haven't even had a bath since the abduction. I must reek of illithid slime.

Astarion_Forest_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Forest_0.text: Sure, but think of the stories you'll be able to tell.

Gale_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_0.context: NodeContext: Fishing for info, a bit awkward

Astarion_WyrmsRock_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_WyrmsRock_0.text: The city fell under Gortash's charms without him casting nary a spell.

Astarion_WyrmsRock_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_WyrmsRock_1.text: Well, most people are idiots, Wyll. You can lure them into a dragon's maw if you promise a bag of sweets.

Astarion_WyrmsRock_2.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_WyrmsRock_2.text: The people aren't stupid, Astarion - they're scared. Gortash provoked a damned war, and then promised them safety.

Astarion_WyrmsRock_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_WyrmsRock_3.text: Safety, sweets - it's the same principle.

Laezel_IllithidColony_2.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_IllithidColony_2.text: Lae'zel - did you ever fight illithid creatures in your training days?

Laezel_IllithidColony_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_IllithidColony_3.text: Never. The ghaik aboard the nautiloid was the first I ever witnessed in flesh.

Laezel_IllithidColony_4.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_IllithidColony_4.text: Really? I figured you would have joined your fellow gith in a colony raid.

Laezel_IllithidColony_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_IllithidColony_0.text: A young warrior is expected to fight their first ghaik with their cousins - kin hatched from the same clutch.

Laezel_IllithidColony_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_IllithidColony_1.text: The ones who triumph earn a place in githyanki society. The one's who don't, perish.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: I'd watch yourself, my friend. I don't know if our pale rogue has anything good in his heart, or even a scrap of it left for you.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: Excuse me? That's just mean - we're all adults here.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: Your heart's cold as ice, Astarion. I'm just making sure no one slips and gets hurt.

Gale_HouseOfHealing_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_HouseOfHealing_0.text: This was a hospital? Feels more like a prison.

Gale_HouseOfHealing_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_HouseOfHealing_2.text: A common enough interpretation. Sickness has a nasty habit of making you feel trapped, if only within the confines of your own body.

Gale_HouseOfHealing_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_HouseOfHealing_3.text: I once spent weeks convalescing in the Hospice of St Laupsenn after a nasty bout of ruddy pox. For all their kindness, leaving that place behind felt like freedom to me.

Gale_HouseOfHealing_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_HouseOfHealing_1.text: I've always relied on the kindness of the healers and menders of the Coast. Better a cleric's healing touch than a chirurgeon's scalpel.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: The fact one of your first dates is going to be one of your last... it's just not fair, Karlach.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: I don't want to think about that. I just want to enjoy whatever comes my way.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: You're worth more respect than every last rogue in this city. I hope you know that.

Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_1.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_1.text: My boyhood texts claimed bodies from this battle drifted downriver for a week.

Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_3.text: Many who deserved an honourable burial had to be abandoned. The shadow curse inspired great haste.

Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_0.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_0.text: That's right - you were there, weren't you?

Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_SCL_BattlefieldRemains_2.text: I was. Part of my spirit was shorn away from me here, and never left.

Shadowheart_Monastery_0.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_Monastery_0.text: 'The Mysteries of the Monastery'. 'The Secret of the Crags'.

Shadowheart_Monastery_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Monastery_2.text: What was that? I really can't abide mumbling, Wyll.
Shadowheart_Monastery_2.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_Monastery_4.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_Monastery_4.text: I'm trying to decide on a title for this chapter of the Blade's adventures.

Shadowheart_Monastery_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Monastery_3.text: Haven't you ever heard 'don't catch your chickens before they hatch'?
Shadowheart_Monastery_3.context: NodeContext: 'don't get ahead of yourself'. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_Monastery_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Monastery_1.text: Or perhaps 'Don't count your adventurers before they survive a arduous, danger-filled journey'?
Shadowheart_Monastery_1.context: NodeContext: 'don't get ahead of yourself'. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: Amorous passions usually make people more considerate, Minthara. Kinder. Sympathetic. Better at cooperating.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: They can also make people more protective, guarded, paranoid, and jealous.

Jaheira_UndercityRuins_0.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_UndercityRuins_0.text: My first visit to the undercity. A haven for undead, or so my tutors said.

Jaheira_UndercityRuins_1.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_UndercityRuins_1.text: Shadow people roaming shadow streets. There's little more to learn down here but some depressing ways to die.

Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_0.text: When I was a child, father sent me to Sharess' Caress to deliver messages.

Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_4.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_4.text: How was I to know what went on behind its closed doors?

Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_1.text: Eating, sleeping, and sex acts of all manner, of course.

Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_3.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_3.text: Hm. What's plain to you wasn't so plain to mini-Wyll.

Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_WC_SouthSpan_2.text: 'Mini-Lae'zel' wasn't so sheltered. On Crèche K'liir, very little is hidden behind doors.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I hope my home can be yours, if you don't go back to the skies.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Chk. I have no intention of allowing myself to grow a third stomach and a withered arm in a ducal seat.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: I meant the Gate! But you're always welcome for tea.

Jaheira_CountingHouse_1.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_CountingHouse_1.text: I was barely eight years of age when I heard the Counting House held mythical treasure.

Jaheira_CountingHouse_2.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_CountingHouse_2.text: So curious little Wyll tried to slip in. The guard spotted me straight away and dragged me by the collar back to my father.

Jaheira_CountingHouse_3.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_CountingHouse_3.text: A talking-to from the Grand Marshal himself. Quite the introduction to a life of crime - what did he say?
Jaheira_CountingHouse_3.context: NodeContext: Amused - playing at not relishing Wylll's punishment

Jaheira_CountingHouse_0.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_CountingHouse_0.text: Oh, he pretended to be cross. But there was no hiding the sly grin that crept on his face.

Halsin_ThormMausoleum_0.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_ThormMausoleum_0.text: No signs of life - but the spirits of the past still linger here.

Halsin_ThormMausoleum_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ThormMausoleum_1.text: Do I note some trepidation? Spirits are but echoes of nature's cycle. Most give no cause to elicit fear... most, but not all.

Halsin_ThormMausoleum_2.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_ThormMausoleum_2.text: When I was very young, father told me the dear ones we lose are quiet - but ever watchful.

Halsin_ThormMausoleum_3.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_ThormMausoleum_3.text: I think he meant to comfort me. But I shivered for weeks, thinking I was being hounded by wide-eyed spirits.

Laezel_MountainPass_1.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_MountainPass_1.text: Lae'zel, are you sure of the greeting we'll find at this crèche of yours?

Laezel_MountainPass_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_MountainPass_2.text: Of course I'll be welcomed. And if you behave, you may keep your head too.

Laezel_MountainPass_3.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_MountainPass_3.text: I can count on you to vouch for me, I hope.

Laezel_MountainPass_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_MountainPass_0.text: Don't worry. You're more useful to me alive.

Gale_Bomb_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Bomb_0.text: Between the orb and the bug, you've got more than your fair share of unwelcome passengers.

Gale_Bomb_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Bomb_2.text: What can I say? Mother always taught me to be a gracious host.

Laezel_Illithid2_1.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_Illithid2_1.text: Can an illithid go solo, Lae'zel? You know - break free of their master?

Laezel_Illithid2_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Illithid2_0.text: Renegades are rare, but not unheard of. Omeluum is one such creature.

Laezel_Illithid2_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Illithid2_2.text: A ghaik gone astray is no less dangerous for it - and its head no less valuable.

Laezel_Illithid2_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Illithid2_3.text: Renegades are rare, but not unheard of.

Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_0.text: Labour is the lifeblood of every city. Baldur's Gate would perish without its workers.

Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_1.text: So it is with the githyanki. Without the mlar's swords and ships, and the gardens of our g'lathk, the empire couldn't thrive.

Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_3.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_SteelWatchFoundry_3.text: Maybe githyanki and humans aren't so different after all.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Astarion, I was wrong about you. Truly wrong about you.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Let me guess - you thought I'd suck blood, but actually I just suck? Was that your witty jab?
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_2.context: NodeContext: A little tired of Wyll's bullshit

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: No, I mean it. There's little between us we share. But you've fallen in love and stood by your lover. That is something this dreamer's heart can appreciate.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: Halsin, tell me about the man behind the hulking wall of muscle.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: Do you actually do anything besides meditate, counsel, fight, train, and make love?

Astarion_Vampire_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Vampire_0.text: Astarion, how is the rat diet going?

Astarion_Vampire_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Vampire_1.text: It may soon come to an end if you don't shut your mouth.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: Karlach... I know I say this every day, but I'm so glad you're here.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: And seeing you've got someone to care about now, after ten bloody years, what would you say? 'Good for you, mate.'?

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_0.context: NodeContext: teasing wyll a little for being a toff

Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_1.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_1.text: Odd - I'd expect a Flaming Fist or four to be stationed nearby.

Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_2.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_2.text: They stick to sunnier streets. Heavens forbid they disrupt any of that Guild business they're so well-paid to ignore, hm?

Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_3.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_3.text: The Fist aren't what they used to be.

Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_GuildhallEntrance_0.text: I grieve to tell you, Wyll, they never were.

Minsc_MorphicPool_3.speaker: Wyll
Minsc_MorphicPool_3.text: Our great adventure nears its climax. If I should fall, I want you all to know it's been an honour to fight beside you.

Minsc_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_MorphicPool_0.text: You will not fall, warlock. And if you do, Minsc shall simply pick you up again. What - do you doubt us in this final hour?
Minsc_MorphicPool_0.context: NodeContext: Not having any of Wyll's final words - everyone is going to survive this, because obviously everyone is going to survive this.

Minsc_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_MorphicPool_2.text: And you are Wyll of the Pale Eye. Now hush, and turn your mind towards our many, many many enemies.

Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_1.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_1.text: Tombstones. I'd half-expect to get a glimpse of Withers here.

Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_2.text: Don't even joke about it. Bad enough that he's haunting our camp, with his cryptic asides and his... overall mustiness...
Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_2.context: NodeContext: Exasperated. Referring to a  undead camp follower of theirs (not presenrt)

Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_3.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_3.text: He's useful, as the not-so-alive, not-quite-dead go.

Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_LastLightGraveyard_0.text: 'Death is the Blade's companion' - isn't that what they say? I think I preferred it as a metaphor.

Jaheira_BasiliskGate_1.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_BasiliskGate_1.text: Mercenary they may be, but father always demanded discipline from the Flaming Fist. Seems some grew unruly in his absence.

Jaheira_BasiliskGate_2.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BasiliskGate_2.text: Your father made a fine job of polishing them up some - but a sellsword is still a sellsword. They are just following their nature.

Jaheira_BasiliskGate_3.speaker: Wyll
Jaheira_BasiliskGate_3.text: And you think the Harpers are more dutiful?

Jaheira_BasiliskGate_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BasiliskGate_0.text: I should hope so - they certainly don't get paid half so well.

Astarion_MoonriseBridge_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MoonriseBridge_2.text: Nothing escapes the Blade of Frontiers' keen senses, I see.

Astarion_MoonriseBridge_3.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_MoonriseBridge_3.text: Mock me all you want, Astarion. We could use a little comic relief.

Astarion_MoonriseBridge_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MoonriseBridge_0.text: Yes, that's why I'm mocking you - to keep our spirits up. No other reason...

ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_0.speaker: Wyll
ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_0.text: Spent a lot of time in this park as a boy battling imaginary monsters.

ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_1.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_1.text: So before you were Blade of the Frontiers, you were Pointy Stick of the Park? How did the imaginary monsters compare with the real thing?

ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_2.speaker: Wyll
ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_2.text: The monsters of my play-fights were strong, vicious. Trolls with hulking muscles, werewolves with sharpened fangs.

ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_3.speaker: Wyll
ShadowHeart_BloomridgePark_3.text: But the greatest villains I've faced as the Blade? They look more like you and me than they do the beasts of my fantasies.

Gale_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.text: I've heard that in Baldur's Gate, 'wizard' is also a term used for one who eschews their more, ahem, carnal desires. Is that true, Wyll?
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: Fishing for info, a bit annoyed about what he's heard

Gale_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.text: Where are we going with this, Gale?

Gale_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.text: Oh, nowhere. I just think it a rather cruel misnomer. Not at all reflective of the glamour wizarding life affords.
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: A bit sulky/sensitive about it

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_AssaultState_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_AssaultState_0.text: This is it, Gale - today, we annihilate the heart of the Absolute's power. The bards will sing of our victory here.

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_AssaultState_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_AssaultState_1.text: Entirely unnecessary. Though if they are so inclined, I might be convinced to share a stanza or two of my own for inspiration.

Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_0.text: Who's in charge of the mind flayers, Lae'zel? Is there a squid king or something?

Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_1.text: No. Each ghaik is servant to an elder brain. No king unites elders - only their collective tyranny.

Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Gale_Illithid1_2.text: A mind flayer monarch, imagine that. Such a thing could shatter worlds.

Halsin_SharTemple_0.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_SharTemple_0.text: The statuary in here is so triumphal. Even the worst of us can see ourselves as heroes.

Halsin_SharTemple_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_SharTemple_1.text: That is a truth that can evade minds far older than yours, Wyll. You are wise beyond your years.

Halsin_SharTemple_2.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_SharTemple_2.text: Not wise enough to avoid Sharran sanctums, apparently.

Gale_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_0.text: I've known goblin raiders to slaughter entire villages and strip them for loot - but I've never seen one ravaged like this.

Gale_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_1.text: It's hard to imagine anyone who'd willingly inflict such devastation, be they zealots, marauders, invading armies... A sign of far worse to come, I fear.

Astarion_Drink_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Drink_0.text: I'm feeling a bit parched and peckish.

Astarion_Drink_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Drink_1.text: Me too. Keep an eye out for any passing vagrants.

Astarion_Drink_2.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Drink_2.text: I'm afraid you'll have to content yourself with vagrant chickens.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Did Zariel know you'd be unable to touch anyone when she crammed that awful thing into your chest?

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: Thing is, I can touch devils and the like, back in Avernus. I never did, cause I'm not a masochist. But I could have.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: Gods. I'm glad you got out of there.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: With my new best friend on my tail the whole time. Who knew.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: I really didn't expect the affair to last between the two of you, Lae'zel. Is it getting to be something more?

Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: We have spilled one another's blood. We have spent blows until utter exhaustion.

Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_2.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_2.text: To think how vibrant this place must have once been. Children playing, merchants hawking. Real people living real lives.

Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_3.text: I know, can you imagine the noise? This is much more peaceful.

Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_0.text: Come, Astarion. I know you're not really as heartless as all that.

Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_SCL_FishermansHut_1.text: Of course not, I'm a pussycat really. Just ask anyone who's seen my claws.

Gale_Tadpole_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Tadpole_1.text: Was a time I tussled with hill giants without breaking a sweat.

Gale_Tadpole_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Tadpole_0.text: Now, a mere werebear could swat me halfway to Amn.
Gale_Tadpole_0.context: NodeContext: Amn = city on the Sword Coast. Pronounced "AAHM" like UK Eng "arm".

Gale_Tadpole_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Tadpole_2.text: Strange things are happening to us. What festers in our minds may well impel our bodies.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I think it's a true shame, that your goddess doesn't allow for love.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I could never regret fulfilling my life's purpose. Besides, Lady Shar may afford me a little... wiggle room.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.context: NodeContext: Unfazed/a little playful at the end. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_0.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_0.text: We're not taking a boat to Baldur's Gate, surely.

Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_1.text: A nice, leisurely voyage? The idea seems pleasant enough... but knowing our luck, we'd probably end up as easy targets the whole away.
Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_1.context: NodeContext: 'wish it ws that easy' Applies to either of SH's arcs

Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_2.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_MoonriseDocks_2.text: Exactly. Not that I'm one to refuse the scenic route, but I think we need to hike it.

Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_0.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_0.text: Father always shooed me away from this place. 'More rats than a Waterdeep dungeon.'

Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_1.text: It is most unfair to pour such scorn on rats - they have their place in nature, same as you or I.
Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_1.context: NodeContext: A little defensive on behalf of rats in general

Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_2.speaker: Wyll
Halsin_PhilgraveMansion_2.text: And I don't get the sense that my father was being literal.

Shadowheart_Warehouse_0.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_Warehouse_0.text: I'm reminded of a book father kept hidden in a drawer. 'The Salty Mermaid'. Do you know of it, Shadowheart?

Shadowheart_Warehouse_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Warehouse_3.text: 'Fabian ran his calloused fingers along Allura's scales. Her tail quivered in response...'
Shadowheart_Warehouse_3.context: NodeContext: fondly quoting a silly romance novel that she's apparently read far too many times.

Shadowheart_Warehouse_2.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_Warehouse_2.text: ' 'Taste me', Allura pleaded. Fabian smashed his lips against hers and their tongues twisted together like two eels in the Sword Sea.'

Shadowheart_Warehouse_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Warehouse_1.text: The pinnacle of good trash - even I can't forget that one too easily. Your father was a man of fine taste.
Shadowheart_Warehouse_1.context: NodeContext: Amused (small acknowledgement that she remembers this of all things, in spite of her memory loss)

Shadowheart_Warehouse_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Warehouse_4.text: The pinnacle of good trash - even I can't forget that one too easily. Your father is man of fine taste.
Shadowheart_Warehouse_4.context: NodeContext: Amused (small acknowledgement that she remembers this of all things, in spite of her memory loss)

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: Astarion, I just want to say - I judged you wrongly. I'm sorry.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Really? And how - specifically - have you misjudged my fine character?

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: You aren't actually insufferably randy. You're just insufferable.

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_0.text: This is no aimless horde - the Absolute's forces are organised. What do you make of it, Gale?

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_1.text: All enemies have some chink in their armour, no matter how much they like to believe themselves invulnerable. That's what we must find.

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_2.speaker: Wyll
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_2.text: And if we don't find any clear weakness?

Gale_MoonriseGeneral_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseGeneral_3.text: Then we hope our mutual strengths are enough to dominate them. Or, we die nobly in the attempt.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: The two of you are the unholiest union I can bloody imagine.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: It's funny - I don't recall asking your opinion, Wyll.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: You had the most precious thing - someone who would do everything for you - and you damn well took everything. 'Degenerate' doesn't half cut it.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I used to believe the beauty of first love was unable to be surpassed.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: But Gale - you are so much more tolerable now you've found your second.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I'll take that comment with the sincerity and good will I assume it was intended.
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.context: NodeContext: Not rising to it, cheerful

Astarion_BlushingMermaid_0.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_BlushingMermaid_0.text: Ah - the memories. The Blushing Mermaid's where fifteen-year-old Wyll snuck his first kiss.

Astarion_BlushingMermaid_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_BlushingMermaid_1.text: You didn't kiss anyone until you were fifteen? Gods, what a tragic, sheltered life...

Astarion_BlushingMermaid_3.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_BlushingMermaid_3.text: Sheltered? Not at all. I was exposed to all manner of riot and revelry. Hells, my father even urged me on once or twice.

Astarion_BlushingMermaid_2.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_BlushingMermaid_2.text: But I've always been a bit old-fashioned on these matters. I find more pleasure in a courtly dance than a loveless fling.

Gale_Astarion_Netherese_0.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Astarion_Netherese_0.text: Ethel mentioned Netherese magic. What in blazes does that mean?

Gale_Astarion_Netherese_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Astarion_Netherese_1.text: Magic from the fallen empire of Netheril. Ancient, exceedingly dangerous, and quite unrivalled.

Gale_Astarion_Netherese_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Astarion_Netherese_2.text: Wonderful! I'd hate to be destroyed by any common old magic.
Gale_Astarion_Netherese_2.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastic. You've been told the dangerous magic inside you is ancient and unrivalled

Gale_SCL_Forest_2.speaker: Wyll
Gale_SCL_Forest_2.text: What a dismal forest. Monsters could be lurking behind any and every tree.

Gale_SCL_Forest_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_SCL_Forest_3.text: We'd be wise to fear the trees themselves. It feels like the forest itself longs for our destruction.

Gale_SCL_Forest_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_SCL_Forest_1.text: Monsters, I can fight. But I can no more sever these shadows than I could the wind or the sun.

Gale_Guildhall_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Guildhall_1.text: It might seem a bit ramshackle, but this place has a boastworthy bar.

Gale_Guildhall_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Guildhall_2.text: A bar is only as good as its cellars. Which vintages can we expect to find on their racks?

Gale_Guildhall_3.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Guildhall_3.text: Here, a bottle is judged more by its ability to crack heads than the quality of its contents.

Gale_Guildhall_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Guildhall_0.text: Ah. If that's the main criteria then I shall reset my expectations accordingly. Water it is.

Karlach_SouthDocks_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_SouthDocks_0.text: Your nose is better than mine, pal.

Astarion_Hunting_1.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Hunting_1.text: Killed a few giant bats in my day, Astarion - but never hunted a vampire.

Astarion_Hunting_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Hunting_2.text: Just to remind you, I'm merely a spawn. It won't count.

Astarion_Hunting_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Hunting_0.text: But if you want a true vampire, I'm happy to recommend one.

Shadowheart_Selune_2.speaker: Wyll
Shadowheart_Selune_2.text: What's your gripe with Selûne anyway, Shadowheart?

Shadowheart_Selune_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Selune_0.text: She betrayed her sister and ruined the balance of things.

Shadowheart_Selune_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Selune_1.text: Imagine turning on those who love you for you own glory...

Laezel_Altruism_2.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_Altruism_2.text: Lae'zel, have you ever done a good deed just for the sake of it?

Laezel_Altruism_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Altruism_1.text: I have performed deeds well and efficiently. Is this what you mean?

Laezel_Altruism_0.speaker: Wyll
Laezel_Altruism_0.text: Not exactly. But you answered my question.
